data.title: What Audio/Video Converter(s) Do You Use?
data.meta_description:
Not going to add a poll since I don't know many options at all. o.o"

So what do you use when you want to convert files from one format to another?

So what do you use when you want to convert files from one format to another?

#2

By far the best software I have ever found for this purpose is MediaCoder (do a search on Google for that exact phrase - it says I can't post off-site links yet). For reference, the term you're looking for is actually "transcoding" and not "converting" but regardless, MediaCoder will take just about any source format and transcode it into virtually anything else. And best of all, it's 100% free.

If you need more of a description than that, let me know. Otherwise, I can't think of a single better program if you're looking to change the format of your audio/video files.

#3

I usually use Visualhub for my video encoding needs, for audio I usually use Audacity. though I rarely ever convert audio since everything I have is usually on a cd or comes in MP3 already.

well for audio conversion i either use koyote soft's free audio converter or samsung phone tools

for video i use free flv converter although i rarely have to convert video unless i am downloading off youtube, because my computer has a huge codec pack anyway.
